1085392_18_ITEM13_P0_S0	Transactions with Related Persons Our Boards of Directors have adopted a written policy for the review and approval or ratification of related person transactions.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P0_S1	Under the policy, our directors and executive officers are expected to disclose to our Chief Compliance Officer the material facts of any transaction that could be considered a related person transaction promptly upon gaining knowledge of the transaction.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P1_S0	A related person transaction is generally defined as any transaction required to be disclosed under Item 404(a) of Regulation S-K, the SEC s related person transaction disclosure rule.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P2_S0	Any transaction reported to the Chief Compliance Officer will be reviewed according to the following procedures:
1085392_18_ITEM13_P3_S0	If the Chief Compliance Officer determines that disclosure of the transaction is not required under the SEC s related person transaction disclosure rule, the transaction will be deemed approved and will be reported to the Audit Committee.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P4_S0	If disclosure is required, the Chief Compliance Officer will submit the transaction to the Chair of the Audit Committee who will review and, if authorized, will determine whether to approve or ratify the transaction.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P4_S1	The Chair is authorized to approve or ratify any related person transaction involving an aggregate amount of less than $1.0 million or when it would be impracticable to wait for the next Audit Committee meeting to review the transaction.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P5_S0	If the transaction is outside the Chair s authority, the Chair will submit the transaction to the Audit Committee for review and approval or ratification.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P6_S0	When determining whether to approve or ratify a related person transaction, the Chair of the Audit Committee or the Audit Committee, as applicable, will review relevant facts regarding the related person transaction, including:
1085392_18_ITEM13_P7_S0	Whether the related person transaction is consistent with the best interests of the Company.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P8_S0	If any related person transaction is not approved or ratified, the Committee may take such action as it may deem necessary or desirable in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P9_S0	Scott Armstrong serves on the Board of Directors of the Company and, until its acquisition by Kaiser Permanente on February 1, 2017, was the president and Chief Executive Officer of Group Health Cooperative (Group Health).
1085392_18_ITEM13_P9_S1	Group Health provided coverage to over 600,000 residents in Washington and Northern Idaho.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P9_S2	Certain employees of PSE elected Group Health as their medical provider prior to its acquisition by Kaiser Permanente.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P9_S3	PSE made no payments to Group Health, as all payments were made after its acquisition by Kaiser Permanente for medical coverage for the year ended December 31, 2017 .
1085392_18_ITEM13_P10_S0	Kimberly Harris, the President and Chief Executive Officer and a director of Puget Energy and PSE, is married to Kyle Branum, who is a partner at Summit Law Group, which provides legal services to PSE.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P10_S1	In 2017 , Summit Law Group was paid $ 0.8 million for legal services provided to PSE and Mr. Branum was among the lawyers at Summit Law Group who provided such legal services.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P10_S2	This work was performed under the supervision of PSE's General Counsel.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P11_S0	Board of Directors and Corporate Governance Independence of the Board The Boards of Puget Energy and PSE have reviewed the relationships between Puget Energy and PSE (and their respective subsidiaries) and each of their respective directors.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P11_S1	Based on this review, the Boards have determined that of the members constituting the Boards, Steven Hooper (member of the Boards of both Puget Energy and PSE), Scott Armstrong (member of the Board of PSE and added to the Board of Puget Energy at the November, 2017 Board Meeting), and Barbara Gordon (member of the Board of PSE) are independent under the NYSE corporate governance listing standards and also meet the definition of an Independent Director under the Company s Amended and Restated Bylaws.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P12_S0	Under the Amended and Restated Bylaws of Puget Energy and PSE, an Independent Director is a director who: (i) shall not be a member of Puget Holdings (referred to as a Holdings Member) or an affiliate of any Holdings Member (including by way of being a member, stockholder, director, manager, partner, officer or employee of any such member), (ii) shall not be an officer or employee of PSE, (iii) shall be a resident of the state of Washington, and (iv) if and to the extent required with respect to any specific director, shall meet such other qualifications as may be required by any applicable regulatory authority for an independent director or manager.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P12_S1	The Company s definition of "Independent Director" is available in the Corporate Governance Guidelines at www.pugetenergy.com.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P13_S0	In making these independence determinations, the Boards have established a categorical standard that a director s independence is not impaired solely as a result of the director, or a company for which the director or an immediate family member of the director serves as an executive officer, making payments to PSE for power or natural gas provided by PSE at rates fixed in conformity with law or governmental authority, unless such payments would automatically disqualify the director under the NYSE s corporate governance listing standards.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P13_S1	The Boards have also established a categorical standard that a director s independence is not impaired if a director is a director, employee or executive officer of another company that makes payments to or receives payments from Puget Energy, PSE or any of their affiliates, for property or services in an amount which is less than the greater of $1.0 million or one percent of such other company s consolidated gross revenue, determined for the most recent fiscal year.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P13_S2	These categorical standards will not apply, however, to the extent that Puget Energy or PSE would be required to disclose an arrangement as a related person transaction pursuant to Item 404 of Regulation S-K.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P13_S3	The Boards considered all relationships between its directors and Puget Energy and PSE (and their respective subsidiaries), including some that are not required to be disclosed in this report as related-person transactions.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P13_S4	Mr. Hooper and Mr. Armstrong, Ms. McWilliams and former Board member Melanie Dressel serve (or served) as directors or officers of, or otherwise have/had a financial interest in, entities that make payments to PSE for energy services provided to those entities at tariff rates established by the Washington Commission.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P13_S5	These transactions fall within the first categorical independence standard described above.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P13_S6	Because these relationships either fall within the Boards' categorical independence standards or involve an amount that is not material to the Company or the other entity, the Boards have concluded that none of these relationships impair the independence of the applicable directors.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P14_S0	Executive Sessions Non-management directors meet in executive session on a regular basis, generally on the same date as each scheduled Board meeting.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P14_S1	Mr. Hooper, who is not a member of management, presides over the executive sessions.
1085392_18_ITEM13_P15_S0	Interested parties may communicate with the non-management directors of the Board through the procedures described in Item 10, "Directors, Executives Officers and Corporate Governance" of Part III of this Form 10-K under the section Communications with the Board.
1085392_18_ITEM14_P0_S0	The aggregate fees billed by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, the Company s independent registered public accounting firm, for the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016 were as follows:
1085392_18_ITEM14_P1_S0	_______________ For professional services rendered for the audit of Puget Energy s and PSE s annual financial statements and reviews of financial statements included in the Company s Forms 10-Q.
1085392_18_ITEM14_P1_S1	The 2017 fees are estimated and include an aggregate amount of $1.7 million billed to Puget Energy and $1.6 million to PSE through December 2017 .
1085392_18_ITEM14_P2_S0	Consists of work performed in connection with registration statements and other regulatory audits.
1085392_18_ITEM14_P2_S1	Consists of tax consulting and tax return reviews.
1085392_18_ITEM14_P2_S2	Consists of software and research tools.
1085392_18_ITEM14_P3_S0	The Audit Committee of the Company has adopted policies for the pre-approval of all audit and non-audit services provided by the Company s independent registered public accounting firm.
1085392_18_ITEM14_P3_S1	The policies are designed to ensure that the provision of these services does not impair the firm s independence.
1085392_18_ITEM14_P3_S2	Under the policies, unless a type of service to be provided by the independent registered public accounting firm has received general pre-approval, it will require specific pre-approval by the Audit Committee.
1085392_18_ITEM14_P3_S3	In addition, any proposed services exceeding pre-approved cost levels will require specific pre-approval by the Audit Committee.
1085392_18_ITEM14_P3_S4	The annual audit services engagement terms and fees, as well as any changes in terms, conditions and fees relating to the engagement, are subject to specific pre-approval by the Audit Committee.
1085392_18_ITEM14_P4_S0	grants general pre-approval for specific categories of audit, audit-related, tax and other services, within specified fee levels, that may be provided by the independent registered public accounting firm.
1085392_18_ITEM14_P4_S1	With respect to each proposed pre-approved service, the independent registered public accounting firm is required to provide detailed back-up documentation to the Audit Committee regarding the specific services to be provided.
1085392_18_ITEM14_P4_S2	Under the policies, the Audit Committee may delegate pre-approval authority to one or more of their members.
1085392_18_ITEM14_P4_S3	The member or members to whom such authority is delegated shall report any pre-approval decision to the Audit Committee at its next scheduled meeting.
1085392_18_ITEM14_P4_S4	The Audit Committee does not delegate responsibilities to pre-approve services performed by the independent registered public accounting firm to management.
1085392_18_ITEM14_P4_S5	For 2017 and 2016 , all audit and non-audit services were pre-approved.
